name: Ama Dabkam Base Camp
description: Base camp for Ama Dablam expedition offering technical climbing access and spectacular mountain scenery.

name: Annapurna Trekking
description: World-famous trekking route with breathtaking mountain views.

name: Annapurna Base Camp
description: Trek through rhododendron forests and traditional villages to reach the spectacular amphitheater of peaks at 4130m elevation.

name: Bagra
description: Traditional village in Manang district known for ancient monastery Tibetan culture and mountain lifestyle.

name: Bandipur
description: A preserved historic town with traditional Newari architecture and mountain views.

name: Bardiya National Park
description: Lush forest home to Bengal tigers, elephants, and rare species.

name: Bat Cave
description: Limestome Cave and Bat Colony

name: Begnas Lake
description: Peaceful lake near Pokhara perfect for kayaking fishing and enjoying serene natural surroundings.

name: Bhaktapur Durbar Square
description: UNESCO World Heritage Site with medieval architecture and art.

name: Bhedetar
description: A popular hill station in Eastern Nepal, near Dharan, known for its cooler climate, lush green hills, and panoramic views of the Terai plains and sometimes even Mount Everest on clear days

name: Bhotekhosi River
description: A Himalayan river known for white-water rafting, bungee jumping, and adventure sports near the Tibet-Nepal border.

name: Boudhanath Stupa
description: One of world's largest stupas and important Tibetan Buddhist pilgrimage site with vibrant monastery life.

name: Budhanilkantha
description: Famous for large stone sculpture of sleeping Vishnu lying on serpent bed in water pool.

name: Changu Narayan
description: Ancient Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu featuring exquisite stone and wood carvings from 4th century.

name: Charang
description: Historic village in Upper Mustang known for monastery cave dwellings and traditional Tibetan lifestyle.

name: Chhomrong
description: Beautiful Gurung village serving as gateway to Annapurna Sanctuary with stunning mountain panoramas.

name: Chitlang
description: A picturesque, traditional Newari village nestled in a valley southwest of Kathmandu, known for its organic farms, pear orchards, and peaceful environment

name: Chitwan Jungle Safari
description: Explore wildlife in dense jungles and spot rhinos, tigers, and elephants.

name: Cho La Pass
description: Challenging high-altitude pass connecting Gokyo and Everest Base Camp valleys requiring glacier travel experience.

name: Chukung
description: Small village in beautiful valley offering alternative route climbing peaks and stunning mountain amphitheater.

name: Churiyamayi
description: Churiyamai is a Hindu temple in southern Nepal dedicated to the goddess believed to protect travelers and ensure their safety on the roads.

name: Dakshinkali Temple
description: Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Kali known for animal sacrifices especially during Saturday rituals.

name: Deurali
description: High-altitude stop on Annapurna Base Camp trek featuring alpine environment and mountain lodge accommodation.

name: Devgat
description: A sacred Hindu pilgrimage site located at the confluence of the Kali Gandaki and Trisuli rivers.

name: Devis Fall
description: A dramatic waterfall just southwest of Pokahra airpot

name: Dhampus
description: Peaceful village offering panoramic Himalayan views traditional lifestyle and short trekking opportunities.

name: Dhorpatan Hunting Reserve
description: Nepal's only hunting reserve, located in the western Dhaulagiri Himal range. Beyond regulated hunting

name: Dhulikhel
description: Historic Newari town famous for sunrise views over Himalayas traditional architecture and cultural heritage.

name: Dingboche
description: High-altitude village on Everest trek known for stone-walled fields yak herding and mountain acclimatization.

name: Dolpo
description: Remote trans-Himalayan region featuring Tibetan culture Shey Phoksundo Lake and pristine wilderness.

name: Everest Base Camp
description: Ultimate trekking destination leading to the base of world's highest peak through Sherpa villages and Buddhist monasteries.

name: Gadhimai Temple
description: An important Hindu shrine famous for large religious fairs.

name: Ghandruk
description: Traditional Gurung village with stone houses terraced fields and spectacular Annapurna mountain views.

name: Ghale Gaun
description: Model eco-tourism village showcasing Gurung culture traditional lifestyle and organic farming practices.

name: Ghami
description: Remote village featuring longest mani wall in Nepal ancient monastery and traditional mustangi architecture.

name: Ghorepani
description: Traditional Magar village serving as base for Poon Hill trek with rhododendron forests and mountain views.

name: Gokyo
description: Village beside pristine glacial lakes offering alternative Everest region trek and Gokyo Ri viewpoint access.

name: Gorak Shep
description: Last settlement before Everest Base Camp featuring basic accommodation and staging point for summit attempts.

name: Gorkha Durbar
description: Historic palace birthplace of King Prithvi Narayan Shah founder of modern Nepal with architectural significance.

name: Gosaikunda
description: Sacred alpine lake complex important to both Hindu and Buddhist pilgrims at high altitude setting.

name: Gupteshwor Mahadev Cave
description: A sacred cave gouses with shiva lingam and indicate stalactite formation

name: Helambu
description: Scenic trekking region known for Hyolmo culture rhododendron forests and relatively easy mountain access.

name: Kanyam
description: A scenic hill station known for tea gardens, greenery, and fresh air.

name: Island Peak Base Camp
description: Base camp for Island Peak climbing offering mountaineering experience and spectacular Himalayan scenery.

name: Janaki Temple
description: A grand temple dedicated to Goddess Sita, revered by Hindus.

name: Jiri BaseCamp
description: Gateway to Everest in earlier trekking days.

name: Jomsom
description: Remote trans-Himalayan region featuring Tibetan culture Shey Phoksundo Lake and pristine wilderness.

name: Kagbeni
description: Medieval village at confluence of rivers serving as gateway to restricted Upper Mustang region.

name: kakani
description: A scenic hill station northwest of Kathmandu, famous for its breathtaking views of the Ganesh Himal range and other Himalayan peaks.

name: kala Pattar
description: Famous viewpoint offering best close-up views of Mount Everest without technical climbing requirements.

name: Kalinchowk Bhagwati
description: A popular shrine and snow destination in winter.

name: Kanchenjunga Base Camp
description: Challenging trek to base of world's third highest peak featuring remote valleys glaciers and mountain communities.

name: Kathmandu Durbar Square
description: Historic palace complex in the heart of Kathmandu city with temples and museums.

name: Khaptad National Park
description: Undisturbed biodiversity and rolling meadows, perfect for meditation and nature lovers.

name: Khulekhani Dham
description: Home to the Kulekhani Dam, which creates the large artificial Indrasarobar Lake

name: Khumjung
description: Twin village with Khumjung featuring Hillary Hospital traditional Sherpa lifestyle and mountain panoramas.

name: Khunde
description: Khunde is a Sherpa village in the Khumbu region of Nepal, known for its traditional culture, stunning Himalayan views, and the historic Khunde Hospital founded by Sir Edmund Hillary.

name: Langtang Valley
description: Beautiful valley trek through rhododendron forests Tamang villages and close-up Himalayan peak views.

name: Lobuche
description: Last major stop before Everest Base Camp offering basic accommodation and stunning peak views.

name: Lo Manthang
description: Ancient walled capital of Upper Mustang featuring Tibetan culture medieval architecture and royal palace.

name: Lukla
description: Gateway to Everest region featuring famous Tenzing-Hillary Airport and starting point for most Everest treks.

name: Lumbini
description: Birthplace of Lord Buddha, a UNESCO World Heritage site and pilgrimage destination.

name: Machhapuchhre Base Camp
description: Base camp offering closest approach to sacred Fishtail peak with dramatic mountain scenery and glacial views.

name: Makwanpur Gadhi
description: A historical fort located in Makwanpur District, with strategic importance during Nepal's ancient and medieval periods.

name: Makalu Base Camp
description: Remote trekking destination to base of world's fifth highest peak through pristine wilderness and diverse ecology.

name: Manang
description: High altitude village on Annapurna Circuit offering acclimatization stunning views and Tibetan Buddhist culture.

name: Manakamana Temple
description: Famous temple of goddess Bhagwati, accessible by cable car.

name: Mardi Himal Base Camp
description: Popular sunrise viewpoint accessible through short trek offering panoramic Annapurna and Dhaulagiri ranges.

name: Muktinath
description: Sacred pilgrimage site for both Hindus and Buddhists featuring eternal flame and 108 water spouts.

name: Monjo
description: Village at entrance to Sagarmatha National Park with checkpoint suspension bridges and mountain lodge facilities.

name: Mustang
description: Former forbidden kingdom featuring Tibetan culture ancient caves monasteries and dramatic desert landscapes.

name: Nagarkot Hill
description: Famous for spectacular sunrise views over the Himalayas and trekking trails.

name: Namche Bazaar
description: Sherpa capital and acclimatization stop on Everest trek featuring markets lodges and mountain culture.

name: Namo Buddha
description: Sacred Buddhist pilgrimage site where Buddha offered his body to hungry tigress in previous incarnation.

name: Panchase Trek
description: A beautiful and culturally significant hill west of Pokhara, known for its pristine natural environment, diverse biodiversity

name: Pangboche
description: Traditional Sherpa village featuring ancient monastery yak pastures and authentic mountain culture experience.

name: Parsa National Park
description: A national park with amazing   wildanimals and scenary.

name: Pashupatinath Temple
description: Sacred Hindu temple complex along Bagmati River featuring ancient architecture and spiritual ceremonies.

name: Patan Durbar Square
description: Heritage square with fine Newari arts.

name: Phakding
description: First major stop on Everest trek offering comfortable lodges riverside location and gentle introduction to Khumbu.

name: Pheriche
description: High-altitude village with medical post serving as acclimatization stop with mountain rescue facilities.

name: Phewa Lake
description: A serene lake with boating options and stunning views of the Annapurna range.

name: Poon Hill
description: Popular sunrise viewpoint accessible through short trek offering panoramic Annapurna and Dhaulagiri ranges.

name: Phulchoki Hill
description: Highest hill around Kathmandu Valley famous for diverse bird species wildflowers and mountain views.

name: Ramdung Peak
description: Climbable peak for beginner mountaineers.

name: Ramtoli
description: Avillage in himlayan region.

name: Rara Lake
description: The largest lake in Nepal, surrounded by tranquil mountains and pine forests.

name: Rengo La Pass
description: Rengo La is a mountain pass in Nepal, known for its scenic trekking routes and panoramic Himalayan views

name: Resunga Hill
description: A sacred hill known for its natural beauty and religious significance.

name: Rupa Lake
description: Pristine freshwater lake offering tranquil environment bird watching and reflection of surrounding hills.

name: Sarangkot
description: A famous hill station near Pokhara, renowned for its spectacular sunrise views over the Annapurna and Dhaulagiri mountain ranges

name: Sauraha
description: Popular tourist hub for Chitwan National Park offering jungle safaris elephant rides and cultural programs.

name: Shanti Stupa
description: A peaceful hilltop with scenic mountain and lake view

name: Shey Phoksundo Lake
description: A stunning turquoise lake in the Himalayas within Shey Phoksundo National Park.

name: Shivapuri National Park
description: Nearest national park to Kathmandu offering hiking trails diverse flora fauna and watershed protection.

name: Sindhuli Gadhi
description: A historically significant fort from the Anglo-Nepalese War, known for the battle where Nepali forces defeated the British

name: Sahid Smarak
description: Large Sherpa village near Namche featuring Hillary School monastery and claimed Yeti scalp display.

name: Swayambhunath Temple
description: Ancient hilltop temple complex known as Monkey Temple offering panoramic valley views and Buddhist heritage.

name: Syangboche
description: Small airstrip village near Namche Bazaar offering mountain flights and access to Everest region.

name: Tansen
description: Historic hill town known for traditional Newari architecture metalwork and panoramic mountain views.

name: Tengboche Monastery
description: Famous monastery on Everest trek offering spiritual experience mountain views and Buddhist culture immersion.

name: Thame
description: Traditional Sherpa village off main Everest trail featuring monastery authentic culture and peaceful mountain setting.

name: Thankot
description: Hill station offering escape from city life with hiking trails mountain views and peaceful environment.

name: Thorong La Pass
description: High mountain pass at 5416m connecting Manang and Mustang districts on classic Annapurna Circuit trek.

name: Thorong Phedi
description: Last stop before crossing Thorong La Pass on Annapurna Circuit providing basic mountain accommodation.

name: Thyangboche
description: Village featuring famous monastery spiritual atmosphere and panoramic views of Everest Lhotse and Ama Dablam.

name: Tilicho Lake
description: One of the highest lakes in the world, nestled at the foot of the Himalayas.

name: Trikhandi Temple
description: Mythical Temple in Thori believed to be visited by Pandavas during exile.

name: Ulleri
description: Scenic village on Annapurna Circuit known for stone steps terraced fields and traditional mountain architecture.
